objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The UK National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) is the primary author and publisher of this threat report, providing analysis and detection guidance for Goofy Guineapig.

objects.name: Goofy Guineapig C2 URL
objects.description: Hardcoded C2 URL in Goofy Guineapig configuration for HTTPS communications over non-standard port 4443.
objects.pattern: [url:value = 'http://HTTPS://static.tcplog.com:4443']

objects.name: Goofy Guineapig mutex
objects.description: Mutex name generated by Goofy Guineapig to ensure single instance, based on quadruple MD5 of computer name.
objects.pattern: [mutex:name = 'MD5(MD5(MD5(MD5(ComputerName))))']

objects.name: Indicator for Firefox-latest.exe (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the malicious Firefox-latest.exe loader.

objects.name: Indicator for Firefox-latest.exe (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the malicious Firefox-latest.exe loader.
objects.pattern: [file:hashes.'SHA256' = '19cef7f32e42cc674f7c76be3a5c691c543f4e018486c29153e7dde1a48af34c']

objects.name: Indicator for setup-stub.exe (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the trojanised NSIS installer.
objects.pattern: [file:hashes.'MD5' = '180e0bb4b570c215bfe7abdf209402aa']

objects.name: Indicator for setup-stub.exe (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the trojanised NSIS installer.
objects.pattern: [file:hashes.'SHA256' = '97f66bcdd73917a8b59d9a1dcac21a58936bcaf91e757a9dfb8e5c320af40f56']

objects.name: Indicator for Goopdate.dll (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the malicious Goopdate.dll.

objects.name: Indicator for Goopdate.dll (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the malicious Goopdate.dll.

objects.name: Indicator for Config.dat (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the encoded shellcode file Config.dat.
objects.pattern: [file:hashes.'MD5' = '3dc1096e73db4886fb66ed9413ca994c']

objects.name: Indicator for Config.dat (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the encoded shellcode file Config.dat.

objects.name: Indicator for Decoded shellcode from config.dat (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the decoded shellcode from Config.dat.
objects.pattern: [file:hashes.'MD5' = '06e1992e6c52af33117d142bdbeef74d']

objects.name: Indicator for Decoded shellcode from config.dat (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the decoded shellcode from Config.dat.

objects.name: Indicator for Decoded binary extracted from the shellcode extracted from config.dat (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the decoded binary extracted from shellcode.
objects.pattern: [file:hashes.'MD5' = 'abbe7d13b13ea4315543bdad187f14b3']

objects.name: Indicator for Decoded binary extracted from the shellcode extracted from config.dat (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the decoded binary extracted from shellcode.
objects.pattern: [file:hashes.'SHA256' = '4ffc7f65e16ce59ff9e6a504f88e0cf56b225c0eb2cf8ec578b3e9d40d9bd898']

objects.name: goofy guineapig
objects.description: Goofy Guineapig is a persistent Windows backdoor that masquerades as a Google update component, delivered via a trojanised NSIS Firefox installer. It maintains persistence as a Windows service, supports multiple communication methods (HTTP, HTTPS, KCP/UDP, raw TCP), and loads additional plugins. The malware implements extensive defence evasion techniques, including sandbox and anti-analysis checks, process hollowing, and obfuscation. It collects and exfiltrates system information, uses HTTPS for C2, and is packed with UPX. Its configuration and plugins are embedded and encrypted within the binary.

objects.name: jolly jellyfish
objects.description: Jolly Jellyfish is another malware family referenced in the report, noted for sharing similar defence evasion techniques with Goofy Guineapig.

objects.name: GoofyGuineapig_sessionstate
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule GoofyGuineapig_sessionstate
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Detects session state stack string setup in Goofy
Guineapig."
        date = "2022-12-13"
        hash1 = "11b82826ec01aeec44e5e2504935b6aaccf51cac"

    strings:
        $1 = {66 C7 45 E8 44 69 66 C7 45 F2 65 64 C6 45 F1 74 66 C7 45 EB
63 6F C6 45 F4 00 C6 45 EA 73 C7 45 ED 6E 6E 65 63}
        $2 = {66 C7 45 ED 65 00 C7 45 E8 41 63 74 69 C6 45 EC 76 EB 2A}

    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x5A4D and
        uint32(uint32(0x3c)) == 0x00004550 and
        all of them
}

objects.name: GoofyGuineapig_shellcodeheader
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule GoofyGuineapig_shellcodeheader
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Detects Goofy Guineapig shellcode header."
        date = "2022-12-13"
        hash1 = "231ac2c5f3c9a833836be65f7443e3525eb1e7a3"

    strings:
        $1 = {10 00 00 00 00 FA 01 00 EA 06 00 00 51 36 25 07 31 25 53 55
08 3A 15 2A 3B 34 2C 34 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00
02 00 00 00}

    condition:
        all of them
}

rule GoofyGuineapig_querysessionargs
{

arguments in Goofy Guineapig."

        hash1 = "11b82826ec01aeec44e5e2504935b6aaccf51cac"

    strings:
        $1 = {6A 05 52 33 DB 53 FF D7}
        $2 = {50 6A 10 51 53 FF D7}
        $3 = {51 6A 0E 52 53 FF D7}

    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x5A4D and
        uint32(uint32(0x3c)) == 0x00004550 and
        all of them
}

objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule GoofyGuineapig_servicestring
{

        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Detects Goofy Guineapig loader service string."
        date = "2022-12-13"
        hash1 = "7961930d13cb8d5056db64b6749356915fb4c272"
        hash2 = "6f5c07c50ce4976ddb3879ce65d3b2f96693dc4c"

    strings:
        $service_string = "C:\\windows\\system32\\cmd.exe /c
C:\\windows\\system32\\rundll32.exe url.dll,FileProtocolHandler
C:\\ProgramData\\GoogleUpdate\\GoogleUpdate.exe"

    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x5A4D and
        uint32(uint32(0x3c)) == 0x00004550 and
        all of them
}

C6 85 ?? F5 FF FF 75 C6 85 ?? F5 FF FF 33 C6 85 ?? F5 FF FF 67 C6 85 ??

        $nStart = {C6 85 ?? F5 FF FF 4C C6 85 ?? F5 FF FF 35 C6 85 ?? F5
FF FF 32 C6 85 ?? F5 FF FF 27 C6 85 ?? F5 FF FF 34 C6 85 ?? F5 FF FF 32
C6 85 ?? F5 FF FF 66}
        $Goopdate = {C6 85 ?? F6 FF FF 49 33 C9 C6 85 ?? F6 FF FF 71 C6
85 ?? F6 FF FF 71 C6 85 ?? F6 FF FF 69 C6 85 ?? F6 FF FF 6E C6 85 ?? F6
FF FF 67 C6 85 ?? F6 FF FF 57 C6 85 ?? F6 FF FF 72 C6 85 ?? F6 FF FF 66
C6 85 ?? F6 FF FF 63 C6 85 ?? F6 FF FF 76 C6 85 ?? F6 FF FF 67}

    ... (truncated for brevity)

    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x5A4D and
        uint32(uint32(0x3c)) == 0x00004550 and
        all of them
}

objects.name: GoofyGuineapig_pdbpath
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule GoofyGuineapig_pdbpath
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Detects Goofy Guineapig debug path"
        date = "2022-12-13"
        hash1 = "7961930d13cb8d5056db64b6749356915fb4c272"
        hash2 = "6f5c07c50ce4976ddb3879ce65d3b2f96693dc4c"

    strings:
        $pdb_path =
"C:\\Users\\Benjamin\\source\\repos\\Dll1\\Release\\Dll1.pdb"

    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x5A4D and
        uint32(uint32(0x3c)) == 0x00004550 and
        all of them
}

objects.name: Create or Modify System Process: Windows Service
objects.description: Goofy Guineapig maintains persistence as a Windows service.

objects.name: Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location
objects.description: Goofy Guineapig masquerades as a FireFox installer and a Google updater.

objects.name: Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion: Time Based Evasion
objects.description: Goofy Guineapig checks the time register twice for a delay of more than 100 milliseconds and will not continue execution if more time has elapsed.

objects.name: Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion: System Checks
objects.description: Goofy Guineapig checks the disk size, physical memory size, and number of logical processors, and will not continue execution if any of the checks fail.

objects.name: Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion: User Activity Based Checks
objects.description: Goofy Guineapig checks for processes running on a system which indicate that it is being reverse engineered or debugged and will not continue execution if any of the checks fail.

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information: Software Packing
objects.description: Goofy Guineapig is UPX packed and packaged in with a legitimate NSIS installer.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: Goofy Guineapig contains stack-based strings which are obfuscated with single byte XOR or subtraction throughout the binary.

objects.name: Hide Artefacts: Hidden Window
objects.description: Goofy Guineapig contains the functionality to perform process hollowing on dllhost.exe, when this is performed the process is created hidden.

objects.name: Indicator Removal on Host: File Deletion
objects.description: Goofy Guineapig initially runs in the location to which it is downloaded, the files are moved to a legitimate looking directory and deleted from the initial download location.

objects.name: Hijack Execution Flow: DLL Side-Loading
objects.description: A legitimate executable is installed by the Goofy Guineapig loader, alongside a malicious DLL which will be loaded by the legitimate executable.

objects.name: Process Injection: Process Hollowing
objects.description: Goofy Guineapig can perform process hollowing on the dllhost.exe binary, injecting content downloaded by the C2.

objects.name: System Binary Proxy Execution: Rundll32
objects.description: The Goofy Guineapig persistence mechanism utilises rundll32.exe and url.dll to execute the legitimate binary which will load the malicious DLL.

objects.name: System Information Discovery
objects.description: Goofy Guineapig sends information about the infected machine in each C2 packet, as an obfuscated ‘Authorization’ string in the HTTP header.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: Goofy Guineapig uses HTTPS for its C2 communications.

objects.name: Fallback Channels
objects.description: Goofy Guineapig contains the functionality to communicate using UDP and the KCP protocol, or direct socket communications, dependant on an embedded configuration string.

objects.name: Non-Standard Port
objects.description: Goofy Guineapig communicates over the non-standard HTTPS port 4443.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Goofy Guineapig
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. goofy guineapig.
